snippet: The monarch population has declined with extreme weather and a lack of the milkweed that the butterflies feed on, experts say.
abstract: Mexico and conservation alliance report that number of monarch butterflies that completed annual migration to their winter home in Mexican forest sank in 2013 to its lowest level in at least 20 years, due mostly to extreme weather and changed farming practices in North America.
lead_paragraph: The monarch population has declined with extreme weather and a lack of the milkweed that the butterflies feed on, experts say.

headline.seo: Monarch Migration Plunges to Lowest Level in Decades
headline.main: Monarch Migration Plunges to Lowest Level in Decades
headline.print_headline: Monarch Migration Plunges To Lowest Level in Decades
